intro: Chamaeraphis cirrosa, commonly known as the silky sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a low-growing perennial that forms dense mats of silver-gray foliage, with fine, silky hairs covering its stems and leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple, blooming in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to withstand drought and high temperatures. Chamaeraphis cirrosa is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental appearance.
